titleStmt.title: Edward R. S. Canby to Brutus J. Clay
CWG1565

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Military Correspondence, 1863-1867

body.p:
War Department
Washington City,
January 21st 1864
Sir,

In reply to your communication of the 16th Instant, I am directed by Secretary of War to inform you that all the Kentucky Troops that were at Camp Parole, (near Alexandria) were sent on the 11th Instant to Camp Chase, Ohio, that being the rendezvous for paroled troops.

Very respectfully
Your obedient servant
Ed, R, S, Canby
Brig Gen'l & A. A. G.

Hon B. J. Clay
House of Representatives
Washington D. C.
Sir having received the above per the War Department in answer to you despatches to to me & my letter &c I enclose for your
